name: Wray L. Buntine
content: Bayesian Models | Insights into components of prior research and aspects of latent academia Bayesian Models Insights into components of prior research and aspects of latent academia Wray Buntine Feeling relaxed at the end of a recent holiday! Some stuff on Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar, DBLP, ORCIDResearch Gate, Github (wbuntine), Twitter (wraylb) and Monash page and Vin Uni page Further Subject Categories: artificial intelligenceconferencedata scienceresultssoftwarestudentstalkstheoryuniversity Other Information: Candidate research students find information here, and details of my students.Software I previously managed is up on MLOSS and Github,  though not actively maintained now I am a professor.I love cooking and am a health and food aficionado:  see my thoughts on health living.I give various talks, though have been limited in travel in the past decade and a half due to family.See my Community Service page for conference and tutorial activity.  As a member of the ACML Steering Committee, the Asia-Pacific Machine Learning community is more of a focus for me.I used to be at NICTA in Canberra (since absorbed into CSIRO and called Data61), HIIT in Helsinki, and even time at UC Berkeley, Google, and NASA, where I left a trail of software and reports. About my blog: Blog entries are found at Recent Posts on the right.Use the Categories at the right to get recent papers, slides for talks, etc.This is a back-dated blog, so some entries at time of relevance rather than time of write-up. Share this: Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook One comment […] Simple unsupervised learning by Wray Buntine [slides]. […] by SEAMLS 2019 Highlights - Elastic AI July 25, 2019 at 2:19 pm Reply Leave a comment Cancel reply Δ Wray Buntine wraylb Professor at Vin University in Hanoi, Director of Computer Science Programs. Recently Professor in Machine Learning at Dept. Data Science and AI, Monash University in Melbourne. I used to maintain software on GitHub, but work on applying Bayesian methods to machine learning and deep learning with lots of great research students and colleagues.
